p: Early in the COVID-19 epidemic, it appeared that children were a protected group, but this may have been because they were less likely to have frequented the Wuhan wet market, or because they were more likely to have asymptomatic or mild disease and thus less likely to have been tested. COVID-19 has affected infants as young as 1 month of age [ 51], most with mild or asymptomatic disease. There have been no reported cases of adverse infant outcomes for mothers who developed COVID-19 during pregnancy.
